result.execSummary:
The defendant Miles Thomas Heberlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles Thomas Heberlein

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:12 AM.
Defendant Miles Thomas Heberlein in court.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is resolved.
Defendant files plea questionnaire with the court.
Court finds defendant waives his right to counsel.
Court questions defendant re: waiver of right to counsel.
Court finds waiver of counsel is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Defendant enters a plea of "GUILTY".
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" 
State requests $300.00 base plus costs.
State requests DNA Sample
So ordered

Court grants motion of the state.
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 10:20 AM.
Defendant Miles Thomas Heberlein in court.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defefndant informs the court he does not qualify for DP services.
Court provides him with State v. Dean form, for completion.
Court questions defendant re: financial information.
Defendant once again informed of his right to counsel.
State moves to continue to April.
So ordered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:04 AM.
Defendant Miles Thomas Heberlein in court.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jane Bucher appears for intake purpose only.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint, court reads charging portion onto the record.
Defendant is informed of his right to counsel, and is provided with the public defender phone number.
State requests $1,000.00 signature bond - no conditions.
No objection.
